name: LemonRX DSM2 receiver with PPM output
description:
This tiny 6 channel receiver from Lemon RX is fully DSM2 compatible for using with Spektrum and other radios. It has PPM output on the end pins which can connect to your DOSD's PPM input without needing a separate PPM encoder. It weighs only 4g so is perfect for your parkflyer FPV project! 

You can de-solder the PPM pins and replace them with female header so that the receiver pushes on to the DOSD for a really light, neat installation. Send me a message with your order, I probably have some female headers you can have. 

Comes with a bind plug and a sticky pad for mounting.

name: Barometric Altitude and Temperature Sensor DOSD-specific
description: The same sensor as the cheaper baros we sell, but this board made by Sea Turtle Labs is pin-matched for the DOSD and comes with a cable. It also comes with outputs on the board and more header pins you can solder on for daisy-chaining more i2c devices such as the Xlator. We are shipping these baros with a free upgrade, a 4-pin female header so that you can push the baro straight onto the DOSD board! Will be shipping from 30th Jan 2013 using ArduIMU on I2C? read this link

name: Barometric sensor for altitude
description: BMP085 chip on a breakout board.

name: Cables for DOSD, XLator and FY-30A
description:
We take the cables that come with the Xlator, cut them down and put plugs at both ends, remove the unwanted wires, and add a wire so that you can power the FY-30A from a spare channel on your receiver. Simple! 

This cable is only available for order when you buy the Xlator

Please note that this is a custom-made cable and is shown as in stock as we have the parts, but sometimes we are busy and so ordering this cable might slow your delivery.

name: FY-30A Inertial Attitude Stabilizer
description:
FY-30A is an inertial attitude measurement instrument used for automated stabilization of fixed wing model aircrafts and two axis camera gimbals. Connected to the DOSD via the Xlator it will give you stabilisation and artificial horizon indicator (AHI). You can simply connect the  data cable, or for the full feature set including 3D mode you need to run the servo cables from DOSD (and/or your receiver) to the FY-30A and then to the servos. You can get the Xlator and a cable set in this shop.

      FY-30A has an integrated three-axisgyro and three-axis accelerometer which controls the aircraft movement in three-dimensional space. By using your remote control, the unit can be turned on or off for the following functions:
       •  Level flight– When stabilizer is activated, the FY-30A will automatically control the aircraft for smooth easy flying. For beginners in RC aircraft flying, this is advantages as it makes flight easier and increases the student pilot self-confidence. The system can be activated throughout the entire flight duration, from take off to landing.
       •  Emergency Recovery- If you lose orientation or feel the plane out of control, then release all control sticks, maintain throttle and switch on the FY30A.The unit will automatically send the correct signals to balance of the aircraft and regain level flight.
       •  Aerobatics– for the experienced fixed wing 3D pilot, the FY-30A can help you achieve a more accurate flight path, especially in windy conditions. FY-30A makes 3D maneuvers such as inverted flight, , crane etc easier and simpler to achieve and maintain. A great way to practice and improve your 3D flying.
       •  First Person View- for long-distance RC flight via video transmitter, the FY-30A will maintain the balance of your aircraft. You only need to control the heading of your aircraft and enjoy the view.
       •  Firmwareupgrade –The FY-30A firmware is upgradable by connecting to your computer via a USB-TTL cable. As Feiyu Tech continuously improves the FY-30A system, firmware upgrades will be released periodically.
 
How it works
      The core hardware for the FY-30Ais the integrated three-axis gyro and three-axis accelerometer which is the basis for inertial sensing. The other major components are an inertial navigation platform and strap down attitude algorithm designed for fixed wing aircraft stabilization.
      When theFY-30A is in auto-balance mode, it detects the aircraft attitude and horizontal positioning and issues commands to servos that adjust the aircraft control surfaces (Aileron, Elevator and Rudder) so that the aircraft remains level at all times. Due to this auto corrective action to maintain smooth attitude and level flight, the FY-30A makes flying very easy.
    When theFY-30A is operating in 3D mode and the aircraft is in an acrobatics flight, the FY-30A will use the 3-axis gyroscope sensors to calculate roll velocity and overall flight attitude. With this data, the system will output corresponding control corrections to maintain a smooth aircraft flight attitude even when doing aerobatics flight.
      Since the FY-30A is self contained, it can be used in all weather conditions, indoors or outdoors. Just power up and take off.
 
Applications
The FY-30A can be used in the followingfixed wing models:
     •  Traditionallayout fixed-wing aircraft with Aileron, Elevator and Rudder;
     •  Flying wings with rudder;
     •  Flying wings with no rudder;
     •  Airplanes with no ailerons (rudder and elevator only)
     • V-tail airplanes with ailerons;
     •  V tail airplanes with no ailerons;
     •  Any other configuration, please email us for consultation - service@feiyu-tech.com

options.name: box cover torn. box is fine..

name: Xlator. The IMU translator!
description: The DragonOSD Xlator is an adapter for the Dragon OSD V2 that allows an FY30A (Recommended), Sparkfun 9DoF (Works out of the box) or Mongoose (Firmware update required) to be connected to the DragonOSD as a replacement for the ArduIMU. The IMU is connected to one end of the Xlator, the serial data is converted to i2c format, the DOSD simply sees an IMU connected. Having an IMU connected to the DOSD gives you adjustable stabilisation in the plane and the option to display an artificial horizon (AHI) The Xlator comes bundled with hook-up cables (two 4-way header plugs to bare ends) and heat shrink cover. Download the manual here We also have the FY-30A in the shop as well as a hook-up cable.

name: CJ's DOSD Case
description:
Rock-solid little case that can take the weight of an anvil! Printed especially for the DOSD V2, it has a little lip to hold the components underneath the board just a little off the base. The lid clips in quite securely but you can strengthen it with a couple of drops of hot glue if you like.

The walls are kind of honeycomb construction which adds strength while keeping the weight down to the same as the DOSD at just 10 grammes!

The new black cases have a glossy "marbled" finished to the top and bottom - see the second picture. 


DUE TO THE LOW VALUE, POSTAGE FOR THIS ITEM IS NOT TRACKED AND NOT INSURED! If you want it tracked and insured, let us know or buy something expensive to go with it!

name: Turnigy 180 degree metal gear servo
description:
12 gram servo for camera panning
2.2Kgcm
0.1s/60°

name: UPS Standard
description:
UPS within a few days to most of Europe before 10.30 if pickup is before 15.00

Not always available, please contact us first!

The price is in addition to the standard postage charge

name: Dragon OSD+ V2, GPS and Current Sensor
description:
Please look at the individual items for a more detailed description...

Here is a complete set;

1 x Dragon OSD+ V2 (latest version with 128k memory)
1 x 10Hz GPS
1 x Current sensor and Deans-style connectors

Please note that the current stock does not include a heatshrink for the DOSD, only the current sensor

name: Camera > OSD > Transmitter Screened Tails with 4 pin Header Connector
description:
Simple video cable with no phono plugs so you can make your own connections to your camera and video transmitter. The ground pin is connected to the screen on all 3 wires for camera input, video and sound output.

A great product if you don't have crimping equipment and 4-pin header connectors

Please note that this item is made to order and can sometimes delay delivery a little.

name: Camera > OSD > Transmitter AV Phono RCA Cable with 4 Pin Header Connector
description:
To save you the wiring, we have created a simple "plug-and-play" cable set to connect the camera signal to the OSD to the video transmitter using RCA Phono jacks that will probably be supplied with your video equipment. There is another lead for the DOSD+ audio. Leads are supplied with lightweight male phono connectors. 

Choose size with the drop-down box. If you want a size that isn't listed, please email the shop.

Colours may change.

Please note that this item is made to order and can sometimes delay delivery a little.

name: Installation cable set for the USB adaptor
description:
A set of cables to connect the DOSD+ to your adaptor. One end lives in the plane and you can fit the socket to the fuselage for easy setting, downloading of GPS traces and uploading of waypoints. This enables you to bury the DOSD in the fuselage if you want to.

We make the fuselage connector with non-reversible Futaba  or "J type" plugs and sockets. 

The in-fuselage cable is 10cm long, the lead to the USB adaptor is 40cm long. If you want another size please contact us.

Please note that this item is made to order and can sometimes delay delivery a little.

name: Dragon Tracks pre-order deposit
description:
What is Dragon Tracks? Hidden encoded in the unused lines of video is a stream of data being relayed from the DOSD+. Dragon Tracks decodes the positional data and points your video receiver's antenna at your plane. Many more features are planned, including telemetry output to allow live tracking on Google Earth

This item IS NOT Dragon Tracks, but your deposit and place in the queue for when it is released! Dragon Tracks is in development but as it is developed by hobbyists for hobbyists, we can't predict a delivery date.  

Hopefully a large number of orders will spur the Dragon team to action and also means that I'll be able to place a large order with the team to manufacture a batch so no-one gets left out

You can cancel your order for a refund but you can't transfer it to someone else, I'll only ship to the Paypal account holder

The deposit amount will be removed from the purchase price and of course you will have to pay the balance plus shipping IN A REASONABLE TIME before I can ship it. I'll email you at your Paypal address when stock is in. 

Please note that I resell Dragon Labs gear, I don't make it, so I cannot guarantee any particular feature, specification or delivery time. The image is of a prototype decoder. I  can't even be 100% sure it will be manufactured!! 

Paypal only allows refunds up to 60 days so any refunds after that will be less paypal fees!

name: Dragon OSD+ V2
description:
***** Latest 128k version***** ***Please Note: If "SOLD OUT" is showing, we can normally break up a complete set to provide you with the individual parts, please send us a message***** More information: click> About the DOSD+ Manual: Here Manual in French: Here thanks to Herve at www.multirotors.fr
Display Features
Voltage 2 ports
Current 1 port
GPS Altitude, Ground speed, Coordinates, Satellites, Track heading, Home heading, LOS Distance, Distance to home
Barometer Altitude, Temperature
Variometer Airspeed, Vertical speed indicator
Compass Magnetic heading
IMU Artificial horizon
Others Elapsed time, Callsign, RSSI, Flight summary, Various display modes, Remote OSD off, Configurable border area
Configuration
On screen menu, Configure via stick input, Configure via PC, Customizable screen layout
Alerts
Warning Range, Altitude, Stall speed, Voltage, mAh, Audio notification, Lost signal, RSSI level
Other Features
Integration Single servo wire link from the DragonLink for multi-channel auto-pilot
Logging Google Earth Logging
Autopilot RTH (Return to home), IMU fly-by-wire
Way points 20 GPS way points configurable on the PC
Hardware
PAL/NTSC auto-detect, GPS auto-detect, UART interfaces, I2C extension bus (various devices supported)
Please note that some of these display options require additional equipment - please see the additional information link Some electrical/electronic knowledge is very useful to assemble and use the OSD. Double check your connections before powering up! ***Please Note: If "SOLD OUT" is showing, we can normally break up a complete set to provide you with the individual parts, please send us a message***** Please also note that the current stock does not include a heatshrink for the DOSD

name: 10Hz GPS
description:
Excellent GPS unit providing 10Hz updates. Fitted with a plug ready to be connected to the Dragon OSD+

NEW VERSION with improved filtering and the altitude limit removed. This requires the latest firmware to be installed on your DOSD.

People have reported getting satellite lock in basements with this unit! Please remember that GPS can be sensitive to interference from cameras, video transmitters etc. Separation from these items is advised, and a toroid on the feed cable close to the GPS can greatly improve lock times by reducing EMR reaching the chip.

name: 80 Amp Current Sensor
description:
Just like the GPS, this unit is supplied with a connector to directly connect with the DOSD+

This will enable you to display not only voltage, but also current and mAh consumed once you have calibrated the DOSD+

The DOSD+ can be powered from the current sensor connection by adding a jumper to the board

name: USB TTL UART adaptor
description: Connect your PC to the DOSD+ to update to the latest firmware, load waypoints, and view live data as well as configure settings. you can do most of the above with a simple program like terraterm, the process is much simplified using Craig Lister's PC Commander. Waypoint programming requires Chris Raynak's Mission Editor See our USB cable set for mounting in the plane. See also our page for the drivers

name: RSSI Cable
description:
Simple connection from the Dragon Link RSSI output to the RSSI input on the DOSD+. Female ends.

If you order this with a PPM cable, I may fold back the ground connection at one end to reduce the chances of a ground loop. You can easily put the terminal back into the connector if you wish.

Choose size with the drop-down box. If you want a size that isn't listed, please email the shop.

Let me know if you would like a 2pin or 3 pin receptacle at the receiver end

Please note that this item is made to order and can sometimes delay delivery a little.

name: Custom Cable Loom
description:
By special request, I can sometimes make custom looms for your plane with filters, regulators and the right plugs and sockets

I'll need to know all the gear you're going to use, the equipment voltages, and the lengths of cable required

Please don't order this without talking to us first, if you are interested please enquire using the contact page

Please note that this item is made to order and can sometimes delay delivery a little.

name: PPM cable
description:
Simple cable to take PPM signal output (all RC channels in one stream) from the Dragon Link receiver to the DOSD PPM input.

The cable is female at both ends and is designed to carry signal and power between your receiver and your servos connected to DOSD

Choose size with the drop-down box. If you want a size that isn't listed, please email the shop.

Please note that this item is made to order and can sometimes delay delivery a little.

name: Power Jumper
description:
A neat and light jumper to connect the OSD pins "power in" and "J1" allowing you to power the OSD from the current sensor's input

(NB A power jumper is INCLUDED with the DOSD, if ordering a DOSD+ you do not need to purchase one of these)
